Researcher in Quantum Optics and Quantum Information [ ](https://github.com/dapingQ) [ ](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=F2A-cqEAAAAJ&hl=en) [ ](mailto:zhenghao.yin@univie.ac.at)

About Me ============================== I am Zhenghao Yin, currently a Ph.D. candidate at the Faculty of Physics, University of Vienna, Austria. My academic journey began with a B.Sc. in Physics from Nanjing University, followed by an M.Eng. in Electronic Engineering at Kyoto University, Japan. Research Interests ============================== ![](venn.svg width=500px) My main research interests focus on quantum optics and quantum information. In my PhD, I work on the interdisciplinary field of quantum photonics and quantum machine learning, aiming to develop novel quantum machine learning algorithms and protocols using photonic integrated circuits (PIC). Working with Prof. Philip Walther, I have designed, simulated, and experimentally demonstrated quantum algorithms on linear optical systems. I have also contributed to the development of a quantum optical satellite payload, now operational in orbit. My previous experience includes extensive cleanroom fabrication of silicon and silicon nitride ring cavities, to generate broadband frequency-entangled photon pairs. I have collaborated with leading research groups in Japan and China, and participated in international projects and secondments. For the usual lab work, I am very active in open-source development, contributing to Python packages for photonic circuit control. My goal is to advance the field of quantum optics and explore its quantum advantage, especially in the context of machine learning. You can find my full CV and publications [here](cv.html).
